title: gutted dad facing bankruptcy after
story: Gutted dad facing bankruptcy after scaffolding planning permission blunderJamie Fuller, , thought he had all the permissions he needed to top , tonnes of hardcore on a field but didnt realise he needed to submit a planning application as he faces an £, bill to remove the scaffolding yardJamie Fuller thought he was allowed to lay , tonnes of hardcore on a plot of land he bought Image: John MyersByConor GogartyAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsA dad is facing bankruptcy after mistakenly building a scaffolding yard without planning permission. Jamie Fuller thought he had all the permissions he needed to top , tonnes of hardcore on a field. The -year-old father of three didnapost know he needed the submit a planning application.Now Jamie, from Llanelli, Wales, faces an £, bill after being ordered to remove the scaffolding yard, WalesOnline reports. He says he has already spent around £, on the project and believes bankruptcy is likely. Jamie said: Iaposm gutted. Itaposs jeopardised the future of my three children. I want to give them the best possible le I can. This will leave me having to sign on.  I feel I will be stuck in a council house for the rest of my le and Iaposm going to be left with nothing. For four years I built up my scaffolding business, working long hours and weekends. I feel like it was all for nothing. Jamie, who employs two scaffolders, bought the disused land from his grandfather Gerald in June  as a base for his business. He said: I thought itaposs paid for, itaposs mine, nobody can tell me what to do and Iaposve no worry of having to leave. It was great. My plan was to build a house there in the future. That was my dream.  The original access point to the site was the same one for my grandfatheraposs house. I didnapost want to cause him problems or depreciate the value of his property by sharing access, so I created a new access point. Jamie applied to Natural Resources Walesfor the right to tip hardcore to level the field, which he described as a flytipping hotspot disused for decades.He said: The land had been all overgrown and I cut it back. It was a bog, a hell of a mess, with a bit of a stream going down the side. There were tyres and fridges and dead animals and rats. You name it, it was there. I must have taken  dumped tyres away. NRW granted an exemption for the dad to use waste materials in construction. He started tipping hardcore and rubble to build a driveway and hardstanding for the scaffolding yard, with a layer of crushed stone on top to make it tidy. In September , the access was in place but Jamie was still laying the yardaposs surface. He says he was then visited by representatives of Carmarthenshire Council and NRW. He said: It panicked me a bit. They were saying their biggest concern was the access. I asked what I needed to do. They said I needed planning permission for access but didnapost mention anything about [tipping for the surface of the yard].  I had lorries coming in and tipping rubble at the time. They could see we were tipping that day and didnapost say anything about it. There was no stop notice for the tipping. He put in a retrospective planning application for the access but says he did not hear from the council until March  telling him he had to block the access, remove the scaffolding and get rid of everything . Jamie appealed but it was rejected. He said: The price to remove all the hardcore will be around £,. Firms are afraid of damaging the road so Iaposm struggling to find anyone to remove it.  The planning inspectorate has said it canapost take personal circumstances into consideration because Iaposve broken planning law which I didnapost know about. Iaposm worried Iaposm going to have bailfs on my door. If it comes to it Iaposm going to have to sell all my equipment to pay for removal. He is now worried about how this affects the future of his children, eight-year-old Jake, four-year-old Thea and two-year-old Indi. The planning inspectorate explained its decision to reject Jamieaposs appeal, writing in its report that the development has signicantly altered and harmed the rural character and appearance of the immediate area. The report also raises safety concerns. It says the access is not perpendicular to the main road, adding: The visibility in both directions from the access is restricted and it is likely that vehicles exiting the site would have to edge out onto the highway to gain visibility. NRW confirmed its waste regulation team had been in regular contact with Jamie up to the work becoming a planning issue which was then led by the council. Senior waste regulation officer David Ellar said: Mr Fuller did not have a permit for this work, he had registered an exemption with NRW. Exemptions are for low-risk waste operations that are exempt from needing an environmental permit but still require the holder to operate within specied limits and conditions. Registering an exemption does not remove the need to apply for other permits or permissions. Waste exemptions must be registered with us before the activity commences. “We de-registered Mr Fuller’s exemption when planning permission was refused by the planning authority at Carmarthenshire Council as the activity was not authorised.” A council spokeswoman added: Before anyone starts a development of any type we strongly recommend that they contact the local planning authority so that they can be advised of what permissions may be required. Having a permit from another body for depositing waste materials on a site does not constitute planning permission.” Read MoreRead MoreMost ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON property news" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts from our Property Market newsletterSubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: healthy mum 40 left bed
story: Healthy mum, , left bed bound for  years after suddenly suffering stroke symptomsLeah Smith, , saw her world turned upside down after suffering stroke-like symptoms in . The mum-of-five, from North Wales, underwent tests and MRI scans to try and find the cause of her symptomsLeah Smith before her diagnosis Image: Family handoutByLaura SharmanFreelance writerCharlotte Hadfield:,  Dec | commentsA mother has been stuck in bed for five years after suffering stroke-like symptoms completely out of the blue. Leah Smith, , has to lie flat and often experiences seizures and numbness around her body. The mum-of-five, from North Wales, underwent tests and MRI scans to try and find the cause of her symptoms after her first episode in . Mum Debbie, , was sat next to Leah when she first took a turn for the worse.It was like an altered consciousness, I could see she wasnapost herself, she told the Echo.She looked a bit vacant, she was able to speak but I would see she wasnapost completely with us so I rang an ambulance. In the weeks that followed, Leah began feeling numbness in her legs and underwent a lumbar puncture to check for multiple sclerosis .  Doctors later discovered that the lumbar puncture had caused a Cerebrospinal fluid leakDespite having procedures to try and fix it, which gave Leah temporary pain relief and allowed her to sit up for an hour at a time, they ultimately proved unsuccessful. She has since been diagnosed with Ehlers-Danlos syndromes- a group of rare inherited conditions that affect connective tissue - and Arachnoiditis. The pain disorder is caused by inflammation of the membranes that surround and protect the nerves of the spinal cord, which leads to chronic pain and neurological problems. In the last five years, Leah has only left her home to attend hospital appointments and this is done with extreme dficulty and the help of a lie down wheelchair. Debbie said: Sheaposs got a lie down wheelchair that she canapost even use at the moment because sheaposs in that much pain everywhere, sowe can get rid of some of the pain and she can get back in that wheelchair, sheaposll get stronger. Her muscles and everything are deteriorating, Debbie said.  The deterioration of her in the last  months is exponential. Sheaposs getting weaker and weaker and in more pain. Since her diagnosis, Leahaposs family have been fighting to get her the help she needs but they fear time is running out. She needs multiple lesaving operations which Debbie said are only available through private healthcare. However, specialist doctors in Germany and England may be able to help her. In the meantime, she has round the clock care including from carers, specialised doctors and hospital procedures. A Gofundme page has been set up with the aim of raising enough money for the operations and specialist transport for Leah. Debbie said: Itaposs devastating that you feel that youaposre in this condition and youaposve had to fight to the extent weaposve had to fight to find out the reasons of whataposs going on. And to try and fight to get help to find out the help is only available with specialists you have to pay for. title: man puts up 30000 christmas
story: Man puts up , Christmas lights - and has to flick  switches to turn them onPaul Bibby decided to string up thousands of lights outside his home this Christmas and he’s hoping the twinkling decorations will help ‘put a smile on people’s faces’Paul spent three weeks in November getting his house ready for Christmas Image: James Linsell-Clark   SWNSByZahna EklundAudience writerAmy Reast:,  Dec | commentsThere’s always that one house on every street that goes absolutely mad with the outdoor Christmas decorations. But one man who earned a reputation for his impressive displays takes Christmas to a whole new level – as it takes him three weeks to get his house ready for the big day. Paul Bibby, from Chelmsford, Essex, spent most of November stringing up around , bulbs on the front and sides of his semi-detached home as part of his “biggest ever” festive display. And the decorations don’t stop at the lights, as there’s also a giant inflatable Father Christmas and a snowman sitting in Paul’s garden.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. He said: It was hard work doing it all on my own - this year is definitely my biggest. People walk past and tell me they have never seen anything like it. Little children love to get pictures with the inflatable snowman - he seems to be the most popular. Paul - who lives with Linda Cummings, , and son Aaron Bibby,  – says that since his grand switch-on on December , every evening he has to flick  inidual switches to fully illuminate the display.  The -year-old carer has been adorning his house with impressive displays for  years, and says the festive gesture is to help raise money for Essex and Herts Air Ambulance - because he wants to give back to the le-saving service. He added: I do it because I want to put a smile back on peopleaposs faces. I just want to make people happy. I do it every year and people around here think Iaposm crazy - but I love doing it. I look forward to it every year. Iaposll carry on until Iaposm too old to get up the ladder! And while Christmas is Paul’s busiest time of year for decorating, it’s not the only time he can be seen clambering up a ladder outside his house. Earlier this year, he also spent weeks adorning every inch of his property with England flags to show spirit for the team in the Euros. Have you got a story to share  We want to hear all about it. The strain was first located in the UK in Chelmsford and Nottingham on November , . Since then, cases have been rapidly increasing across the country. Professor Paul Hunter, from the school of medicine at the University of East Anglia, warned that the Omicron iant is spreading rather more quickly than the Delta iant. The UK government are imposing a series of new restrictions and rules in light of the new strain. These include updates to travel rules and changes to mask regulations, as well as a new government push on booster vaccines. To find out how many Covid cases have been confirmed so far in your area, enter your post code in the widget below. Experts have said that there are early signs that the new Omicron iant could become the dominant strain within months. It is not yet knownthe new iant increases hospital admissions or is impacted by the common vaccines.:Lucy AplinEarly signs Omicron could become dominant strain Expert Professor Paul Hunter has told the BBC that the Omicron iant could aposoutcompeteapos the dominant Delta iant within months. He said: the early signs are it will probably spread quite quickly and probably start outcompeting Delta, and become the dominant iant probably within the next weeks or a month or so at least.Scientists donapost yet know how much the new Omicron strain is impacted by the common Covid vaccines. :Lucy Aplin new cases of the Omicron iant detected in the UKYesterday the UK recorded  new Omicron cases. of these were reported in England.This takes the total number of confirmed Omicron infections to  so far.Most ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON CoronavirusOmicron iant" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily coronavirus email newsletter with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: postman boycotts rude house accused
story: Postman boycotts rude house which accused him of pretending to try to deliver parcelsA Royal Mail postman has vowed to boycott a home after a rude note was left telling him to not even think about leaving an attempted delivery card againThe postman says he wont be delivering any mail to the family for Christmas Image: Kennedy News   FacebookByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Dec | comments A family have found themselves on a naughty list this Christmas, after leaving a rude note for their postman, accusing him of just pretending to attempt to deliver their parcels.Postman Dave, whose name has been changed for his privacy, found a handwritten note on the front door of one of his customeraposs homes, warning him to not even think about leaving an attempted delivery card. Royal Mail. Donapost even think about putting a card through the door without ringing the doorbell and pretending that the delivery was attempted but no one was in - as happened on Saturday, the passive aggressive note read. We were in all day and weaposll be in today, Tuesday. RING THE BELL AND DELIVER THE PARCEL.  Itaposs fair to say that Dave was not happy with the message, and later posted a photo of the note on a social media group of postmen and women, saying he hopes the family enjoy collecting their mail from the post office over Christmas. Enraged postmen and women rallied behind their colleague, condemning the residentaposs cheeky and awful attitude pointing out that no postie would want to hold onto someoneaposs mail longer than necessary. Dozens backed Daveaposs stance and suggested he issue Ps from here on - Royal Mailaposs code for their apossorry we missed each otherapos attempted delivery red note. Donapost know about anyone  but I love carrying parcels around with me all day making my bag heavy, one postie joked, while another questioned: Why do people never think that itaposs actually much easier for us to get packets delivered and not have to take them back to the office. Dave, who had been completing that round for the past decade, says itaposs the second time heaposs been spoken to like this and that he has no plans to deliver there again in the future.  In a series of comments responding to questions from other postal workers, Dave said: [Iaposm] not planning on delivering there in the future, itaposs the second time Iaposve been spoken to like this along with the van share guy. [They] stopped tipping a few years ago after accusing one of us of theft and speaking to us like sh*t. It wasnapost me [who left the attempted delivery note], probably a parcel driver but itaposs my delivery Iaposve had for the last  years. [But it] would have been one of the parcels we left for someone  to do, either way itaposs aimed at us. On the positive side, I got a nice tip from one of the decent customers not long after. Later on, Dave gave an update, claiming his employer Royal Mail has backed his stance, telling him not to deliver to the home until the situation is investigated.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. He wrote: [Iaposve been] told not to deliver to them and ignore them for now until it gets looked into. But, this isnapost the first time Dave has found himself clashing with customers, having previously bragged about writing a naughty list, with anyone who leaves notes for posties going straight on there. In June , he wrote: Iaposll gladly stand in the p***ing rain and cold to write out a  for someone like that, they will never get off the naughty list as long as Iaposm on the duty. Any note left on door saying waiting for a Christmas present or passport leave with neighbour or some other place, no can do bud, enjoy your trip. Meanwhile, other postal workers were quick to comment sharing their own experiences with rude customers, with one writing: Thereaposs always one idiot. I had someone swear at me because I rang the bell three times because I knew she was in. aposI was in the f***ing shower, I heard you the f***ing first time.apos Form left after that. A second said: Itaposs psychological, I have someone on my round always thinking Iaposm holding back their parcels, itaposs personal. Usually stuff from China, cheapest postage. They donapost understand the journey their thing has taken. I reckon virtually every round in the country has at least one of those. A Royal Mail spokesperson said: Every single item of mail is important to us. Our postmen and women work extremely hard to deliver to mail to customers across the country, six days a week, in all weathers. Thankfully the vast majority of items are securely delivered to customers, butwe believe a customer is not at home, we will attempt to deliver the item to a neighbour and leave a card. If we canapost deliver to them, weaposll leave a card and take the item back to the Customer Service Point where customers can either collect it or arrange a redelivery. We would advise anyone who has delivery concerns can contact the Royal Mail customer service team.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news uk-news pregnant-mum-living-home-walls-"Horror Hull houses attic roomByIvan Morris PoxtonAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Dec | commentsA pregnant mum and her family are in urgent need of repairs for their not liveable house. Katie Dean says there have been problems since they moved into the house in Hull in September . Images from inside show plaster peeling off walls, a hole in one ceiling, as well as extensive damp and mould. The mum claims that her -year-old daughter moved out because she was too embarrassed to live there.Katie, who lives in the house with her partner, toddler child and with a baby on the way, told HullLive: Itaposs not liveable. My key worker from Target Housing has been and Iaposve told him I want moving out of the property, itaposs seriously affecting my mental health. My -year-old has moved out of the house to live with her dad, partly because it was too embarrassing to bring people around. She is also worried about her toddler, who she claims is getting chest infections. Katie, who is in her s, said Target Housing has responded to her and that some repairs have been attempted. The repairs included the replacement of a boiler  days after the previous version packed up, the fitting of a dormer window, an extractor fan and a new radiator installed in the bathroom.  However, Katie claims itaposs barely scratched the surface of all the houseaposs signicant issues. She says that work to insulate the roof and prevent a leak in the attic had not been effective. She said: Weaposve actually now found that it is still leaking and the roof is all damp and wet. Itaposs disgusting - itaposs actually growing mould on it and I canapost get rid of it.  I had a new window fitted, a new dormer window, thataposs brilliant. But the mould above it must be because of a leak and itaposs like growing. Katie claims a new radiator that was fitted in the bathroom led to signicant damage to the wall beside it, which she was still waiting for to be repaired. She further claimed that the issues with the houseaposs living room - damp walls, the adjacent hallway wall falling through and being too cold - are so extensive that the family had effectively abandoned using it.  She said: I mean, my living room was beautul. I adore ornaments because thataposs what Iaposm into. And I canapost use none of it because it would just end up on the floor smashed and broken because of the walls and things. She added: This was only to be temporary until I got my money, finances, things like that, sorted out.  She added they were moved in with the assistance of Target Housing and were paying back prior rent arrears to the council. Members of Hull City Councilaposs environmental health team have also visited the property two times, Katie said. She added: Andthey canapost work around us doing that, then move us out. Thecontacted Target Housing for comment.Most ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON PregnancyMental healthHousing" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news queen-surprising-hidden-talent-shows-"Queen wanted to set example at Christmas says expertByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Dec | commentsVery few people can claim to really know the Queen and her hidden skills and talents.But one of them is her dresser Angela Kelly, who is said to be very close to Her Majesty.And she once revealed that the monarch is actually a great mimic, and can do hilarious impressions of other peopleaposs accents. In a rare interview in , Angela Kelly even ulged that the Queen mimics her Liverpudlian accent. She said: We have a lot of fun together. The Queen has a wicked sense of humour and is a great mimic.She can do all accents — including mine.  Angela, who was the daughter of a dockworker in Liverpool, was given The Queenaposs support for her tell-all book - The Other Side of The Coin: The Queen, The Dresser and the Wardrobe. The decision to support the book is unprecedented, proving just how highly regarded she is by the Queen.After starting in  as a dresser, Angela is now solely responsible for how Her Majesty looks in public and has even made several of her most memorable looks. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. And who knows, maybe Angela is busy at work making some outfits for the Queen to wear this Christmas Thataposs because the monarch has told her family she is well enough to host Christmas at Sandringham this month after recovering from a back sprain. The -year-old assured them she is feeling “far better” and is “looking forward” to the traditional festive get together at her Norfolk estate.  Concern for the Queen’s health has been heightened in recent weeks after she pulled out of a number of major engagements. But a source said: “The Queen has told everyone she is feeling far better of late and is very much looking forward to welcoming them for Christmas. “Like many other families, this will be the first time Her Majesty can gather with her extended family after being kept apart for so long due to the coronavirus pandemic.” Royal fans will be hoping toto the estate on Christmas Day to catch a glimpse of the royals as they walk en masse to and from the th Century St Mary Magdalene Church on the Sandringham property. The Queen is said to be “determined” to attend church with the rest of the family, but will as in previous years be driven to the church to save her walking the short distance.Christmas guests will include Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall and the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and their three children. news uk-news stepmum-only-felt-sorry-herself-"Arthur Labinjo-Hughes: Balloons are released in remembranceByAmy SharpeReporter:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsArthur Labinjo-Hughesaposs killer didnapost show remorse and only felt sorry for herself in prison, her cellmate has said. This week Emma Tustin, , was sentenced to le with a minimum term of  years for killing her six-year-old step-son. While in remand during the trial, she shared a cell with a prisoner called Elaine for six weeks at Eastwood Park prison, Gloucestershire. The former cellmate claimed that the murderous step-mum never once mentioned Arthur or his death. Arthuraposs father, Thomas Hughes, , was sentenced to  years for manslaughter - but Tustin was said to have been upset that he was cold to her during their trial. “She always felt sorry for herself, Elaine told the Sunday Mirror.  One day she came back from a plea hearing and was upset, so I asked, ‘What’s wrong ’ “She said, ‘He didn’t look at me, Tom never looked at me’. That was the only time I saw her upset about anything.” Elaine had been recalled to jail for battery and criminal damage. She said Tustin used to “laugh and joke” on the phone.  Elaine claimed the mum of four told her own mother she would never see her grandchildren again unless she retracted statements about Arthur. She only discovered the truth about the charges Tustin was facing when she found and read her case paperwork. “We had a fight – it was me more than her. I got angry because I’d read about how he [Arthur] had  bruises and I asked how she wouldn’t notice when she gave him a bath, she added. “She said she just used to give him a towel.  “I pressed the bell and saidthe prison officers didn’t get her out then I’d be staying there a long time.” Tustin was moved to a dferent cell. But Elaine said after inmates learned how Tustin poisoned Arthur with salt, they laced her meals with it. She said: “Some of the things we did were cruel – but she was crueller to Arthur so she deserved it.”  Today dozens of residents paid a touching tribute to Arthur outside the house in Solihull where he was killed. Organised by a local resident, the vigil saw people laying flowers, holding balloons and placing posters and banners paying tribute to Arthur at the property. His maternal grandmother Madeleine Halcrow could be seen wiping away tears at the vigil while wearing a T-shirt bearing his face. The crowd lined the road before letting go of the balloons, some bearing messages, and applauding. Residents, some with tears in their eyes, could be heard saying bye Arthur and fly high always. They then formed a line outside the house before balloons, posters and flowers were placed around the property.  The words You are loved Arthur were put on the boarded-up window. A Birmingham City flag was also placed at the scene, along with a picture of Arthur. The Government has announced a major review into the circumstances which led to the murder, aiming to determine what improvements are needed by the agencies that came into contact with Arthur before his death. The National Child Safeguarding Practice Review Panel will lead the review and will provide additional support to Solihull Childrenaposs Safeguarding Partnership. It emerged in court the boy had been seen by social workers just two months before his death, but they concluded there were no safeguarding concerns. title: struggling woman turns pet food
story: Struggling woman turns to pet food bank after being forced to feed dog pastaDebi Emmett, aged , from Cardf launched the Pet Food Bank Service charity in  - and this year, has provided more than , meals for pets in needRuby, the Pet Food Bank Service charity mascot and quality control engineer Image: Debi EmmettByBethan ShufflebothamNiche Writer:,  Dec | commentsChristmas is the most wonderful time of the year for many people. For others, it brings money worries, and having to make the tough decision as to whether to heat their home, or eat their next meal. Four years ago, Debi Emmett decided to take action and do something to alleviate the stress for pet owners who found themselves in hard times, by setting up a pet food bank service.And this year alone, she’s provided , meals to animals across South Wales, up , the previous year.The -year-old said: “A friend told me about dog’s homes being overrun with elderly dogs because everyone wanted puppies. I thought it was terrible, and as it’s usually older people who adopt older dogs, these are the kinds of people who already struggle with the heat or eating issue. “But these dogs are their worlds and in order to keep them on sofas and out of shelters, we started up the pet food bank.”  Debi, from Cardf, started the charity solo, and would collect and deliver pet food in the area, but Covid- brought new challenges, changing the way the food bank operated. Instead, she began delivering to other food banks with established users, who were elated to discover that there was dog food in their food parcels. Debi’s heart broke when she heard a story from one woman who was struggling financially, and resorted to feeding her dog pasta. The charity founder said: “One lady said ‘I have nothing in the house so I fed my dog pasta - I know it’s no good for them but it’s all I had’. The TeamDogs Christmas Gt Guide, sponsored by Keep Wales Tidy, is packed with more than  treats, toys, gadgets and garments to make every dog’s tail wag with holly jolly joy on December . Weaposve tried and tested many of the gts on our own TeamDogs friends so you can ensure they’re worth placing under the tree for your most special member of the family. To download our Christmas Gt Guide for free simply subscribe to the TeamDogs newsletter. “That’s really sad, because it’s all she had as well. ”Another told me ‘My dog is my family, it’s really good to know that there’s help there for them.’” And on one occasion while delivering to a Swansea foodbank, Debi couldn’t unpack the tins of food faster than they were being snapped up by people in need. The pet food bank service helps people in financial crises, the homeless, and throughout the pandemic, many furloughed workers.  The -year-old added: “It’s not just homeless people we help. In the pandemic there were airline pilots who thought they had a job for le, suddenly found themselves out of work and lost all their income. “It’s not necessarily people who can’t afford their animals, it’s people who found themselves in a dficult situation through no fault of their own.” And Christmas is set to be an incredibly busy time for Debi, who spends up to  hours a week collecting and delivering food to outlets in Cardf, Newport, Caerphilly, Swansea, Gilfach Goch, Merthyr and Bargoed. But after a year like no other, it’s set to be a festive season like no other for the charity, too, with Debi expecting more and more demand for pet food throughout December.  TeamDogs is a community for dog lovers who want to get the most out of their relationship with their best pal. Make sharing the cutest photos of your dog your first job on the website and after youaposve done that, leave a tip to help fellow dog owners live their best lives as a proud pooch parent. Search through hundreds of recommended walks, treats, toys and places to stay when youaposre on an adventure together. From dog-friendly pubs to product reviews and the latest news, you can snf it all out at TeamDogs. She said: “We have provided more than , meals for pets this year, and the sad part is, that could have easily been doubledwe weren’t restricted by our storage size. “Normally in November and December we don’t get asked for that much food, instead people are donating it because they’re feeling generous, and then it gets sent out to families in January. “But this year we’re expecting a lot of people in need of our service at Christmas, and we need that generosity to continue so we have enough food for December, January and February.” As well as pet food, Debi also collects coats for homeless dogs, as well as leads, collars, harnesses and blankets for pet owners who might need them. The animal lover - who has a rescue French bulldog, called Ruby - hopes to open a café in the future, complete with doggy play area and extra storage, where service users will be able to socialise. She added: “Next year I’m looking to start fundraising for a café, but property in Cardf is quite expensive. If we can do it, hopefully it means we could double what we’re doing now.” Read MoreRead MoreMost ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TeamDogsDogsFather ChristmasAnimalsHomelessness" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: three legged puppy abandoned due
story: Three-legged puppy abandoned due to disability finds loving family in time for ChristmasRoo the whippet was left at an animal shelter after she was born with just one front leg, but she’s now been adopted into her forever home just in time for ChristmasByZahna EklundAudience writerBradley Stokes:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsChristmas is known as a time of giving and it’s also the time of year when people are more likely to open up their homes to those in need. And one couple has made the Christmas wish of an adorable three-legged whippet puppy named Roo come true, as they’ve given her a forever home just in time for the big day. Roo was born with just one front leg and at two months old her previous owners gave her to the Blue Cross charity because they didn’t have time to care for her. The pooch was placed into foster care to adapt to a home environment and after being put up for adoption, she was quickly snapped up by her new owners, Amanda and Steve Hofford.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. The couple, from Basingstoke, Hampshire, lost their beloved basset hound Mabel just after last Christmas and say Roo has helped fill the void in their lives. Amanda said: We had never been without a dog for  years so to say that we all felt the loss was an understatement. All our previous six dogs had been rescue dogs, so it was a no brainer to rescue again. When we saw her on the Blue Cross website, she was absolutely adorable. We read her story and knew we had to try to adopt her. The whole process and understanding to our situation was amazing.  She was a much wanted and needed addition to our family. Everyone she meets and greets falls in love with her. She is so funny, inquisitive, loving, lively and we wouldnapost be without her. Roo quickly settled into le in her forever home, and she doesn’t let her disability stop her from doing everything a four-legged dog would do. And Amanda says the adorable pooch loves nothing more than cuddling up on the sofa with her new owners, making friends with other dogs in the park and playing with her toys. The woman added: When Roo came to us she had been so wonderfully taken care of by her foster family and Blue Cross that she was a delight. She settled straight away on the first day, it was like she had lived here her whole little le. She has a front leg missing but this is no obstacle to her at all. She runs around, flies up and down the stairs and does absolutely everything a four-legged dog would do. Absolutely nothing stops her, we often forget she has a leg missing as this has never been an issue. We have had to make no accommodations to her being three legged because she takes her whole le in her stride and lives it to the full.Anyone wishing to adopt an animal from the Blue Cross or wishing to make a donation to the charity can visit: https:www.bluecross.org.uk christmas.Have you got a hopeful story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: residents stunned extraordinarily fat bear
story: Residents stunned as extraordinarily fat bear captured staggering past cameraA whopping black bear was seen waddling past a nature trail camera in Voyageurs National Park in northern Minnesota, with its belly so large it was almost touching the groundThe black bear was carrying around some serious heft Image: FacebookByMilo BoydNews Reporter:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsA black bear that is enormously overweight has caused a ripple online. The large Ursidae was spotted in Minnesota on a nature trailaposs cameras and immediately impressed with its hefty size. Footage of the four legged mammal shows its stomach almost touching the ground as it takes each step.The bear was caught on film just south of the Voyageurs National Park in northern Minnesota on October , Fox  reported.“This might be THE fattest bear we have ever seen in our area!” the Facebook account for the project posted along with the video on December . “How much do you think this porker weighs ! Unfortunately, we only got one video of this beauty but it is enough to appreciate the bear’s curves and figure...it worked hard for that body. “We are still going through trail camera footage from this past summer and fall where we are finding and trying to share some gems like this. “With the number of cameras we have out, it takes quite an effort to get through all of the footage.” The signicant heft of the bear led some to question whether it was unnaturally large. “Is he ok  Are they supposed to get this big ” one viewer asked. Others suggested it had found itself a source of human food with particularly high fat content. Steph Horner, of the Vince Shute Wildle Sanctuary, said the bear was completely fine. Bears in northern Minnesota try to gain  to  per cent of their weight since they hibernate and may not eat for  to  months,” she added. “I suspect he’s actually a bear from my sanctuary in Orr and managed to find additional food sources after we closed for the season.”  Some viewers thought the Minnesota bear could rival the winner of Fat Bear Week put on by Alaskaaposs Katmai National Park. In  a salmon chomping beast was crowned the winner of the competition.  - who is named after the famously large plane - scooped the prestigious gong during Alaska’s annual battle of the heavyweights. The bear, one of more than , brown bears roaming Alaska’s Katmai National Park and Preserve, was victorious on Tuesday after a week of frenzied online voting. Winner  was a worthy champion, the park said in a statement. “This year he really packed on the pounds, looking like he was fat enough to hibernate in July and yet continuing to eat until his belly seemed to drag along the ground by late September,” the park said. title: woman lured tinder date chopped
story: Woman lured on Tinder date chopped into  pieces by twisted sex cult killersVictim Sydney Loofe, who lived in lived in Lincoln, Nebraska, USA, was chopped into  pieces by twisted sex cult killers Aubrey Trail and Bailey Boswell after a Tinder dateSydney Loofes body was found dumped and in pieces in a fieldByGail Shortland:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsDressed in a white jacket and a cream shirt, Sydney Loofe took a selfie and shared the photo on Snapchat with the caption, “Ready for my date.” Sydney, , was smiling for the camera and looked excited. She had even added a heart-eyed emoji. It was good to see Sydney happy. Her loved ones knew she’d struggled with depression, but she was always trying to stay positive. A tattoo on her arm read, “Everything will be wonderful someday.” And her new romance was making her feel hopeful. It was  November  and Sydney lived in Lincoln, Nebraska, where she worked as a cashier at a hardware store. Her parents, George and Susie, lived three hours away, but they would get together as often as they could and messaged each other constantly. Sydney had told her friends that she’d met a woman called Audrey on Tinder. She’d even shared Audrey’s picture with them. She had been on one date with Audrey two days earlier – where they had simply driven around getting to know each other. Now it was time for the second date and she headed out.  But the next morning, Sydney didn’t turn up for work. She wasn’t ing messages from her parents, so they got in their car and drove straight to her apartment. They found Sydney’s cat Mimzy hungry and abandoned and knew something bad had happened. Sydney would never have neglected her cat. Her car was still there and her mobile was turned off. They filed a missing person’s report with the police. The last time her phone was on, it was in Wilber – about  miles away. Fears were that Sydney had been abducted and her parents made an emotional public plea for her safe . Investigators focused on Sydney’s date, Audrey, and tracked down her phone number after linking with her on Tinder. The woman who answered admitted going on a date with Sydney, but said she’d left her at a friend’s house afterwards. She couldn’t recall where that was. Police noted that Audrey was reluctant to share basic details about herself. Eventually, officers discovered that “Audrey” was a woman called Bailey Boswell, then . She lived with her older boyfriend Aubrey Trail, then , in Wilber. They were both named as persons of interest. Boswell had been using a dferent mobile to send messages to Sydney and that phone, as well as Trail’s and Sydney’s, led the police to a location  miles west of Wilber. There, on  December, Sydney’s body was found. Her dismembered remains were stuffed in rubbish bags in ditches in a field near Omaha.  Sydney’s body had been cut up into  pieces – some of her organs and body parts were never found. The cause of death was suffocation and she had put up a fight in her final moments. Her earlobe was torn and she had bruising on her wrists, the back of the head and her inner thighs. She’d clearly been restrained before she was deprived of air. Investigators were certain that Boswell and Trail were involved. They turned out to be a very disturbing couple. Boswell had met Trail when he answered her online advert for massages. She had a young daughter who she had lost custody of. Trail and Boswell had a lot in common – including dark fantasies. They moved into a basement flat together in Wilber in June  and started defrauding antiques dealers. The pair enjoyed group sex with other women, who they met through Tinder. Trail told them stories about “gaining power” from killing people. Police determined that Boswell had lured Sydney into a trap and she had been murdered. There was even surveillance footage of Trail and Boswell out before Sydney’s date, where they bought tools and bleach. The pair were arrested in June  and charged with Sydney’s murder. Right from the start, Trail was a liar. He told a newspaper that Sydney had agreed to be part of a sexual fantasy with him and two other women, while Boswell was passed out on drugs in another room. It had got rough and something had become tight around Sydney’s neck. Trail also told his lawyers that he’d had a “sex party” with just Boswell and Sydney. They had all had sex but while Sydney was handcuffed, he had choked her with an electrical cord and had killed her. But even in the courtroom during the trial in , Trail would change his version of events again. The prosecutors said that the twisted couple had already planned on killing someone before finding Sydney on Tinder. Boswell would connect with the woman after she and Trail picked a target together by looking on social media. Hours before Sydney’s death, Trail and Boswell were buying the tools and supplies used to dismember her. They had even chosen Sydney as she lived  miles away from her family, hoping her disappearance wouldn’t be noticed for a while. They were wrong. Then, during proceedings, Trail grew angry at negative testimony about his girlfriend’s guilt and screamed, “Bailey is innocent and I curse you all!” before using a blade to cut his throat. Trail was taken to hospital and ended up missing most of his own trial. He ed to testy in his defence with scars on his neck. The defence said that Sydney had agreed to be filmed doing “sexual asphyxiation” infor money. But when Trail took to the stand, he shocked his own legal team by admitting that was also a lie. The killer said he had spun stories to confuse the investigators. “It was only me, Bailey and Sydney there the night Sydney died. There were no two other girls there. There was no , paid for a sexual fantasy,” Trail said. He claimed Sydney’s killing wasn’t planned, but she had been lured to the apartment by Boswell and Sydney had “freaked out”. They’d hoped she would join their sex ring and criminal activities. When she resisted, Trail killed and dismembered her with a saw to “protect” their lestyle. And the court were given a horric insight into that lestyle. Three women testied about being lured into Trail and Boswell’s sex cult via Tinder between June  and the November Sydney died. Trail said he was a vampire who could fly and read minds. He and Boswell both alleged they could gain more “powers” by killing people – even morethey tortured them first. The women would have sex with Trail and Boswell in exchange for an allowance. They also helped in the antique business scams. Trail made them call him “Daddy” and he would call Boswell “The Queen Witch”. There were strict rules about staying in touch with Trail and they spoke about being punished. If they broke rules, they would be slapped or even choked with a belt. When one woman left the sex cult, Trail had threatened to kill her familyshe told anyone. The jury took just three hours to deliberate. The couple were both found guilty of first-degree murder, criminal conspiracy to commit murder and improper disposal of human remains.  In June this year, at a sentencing for Trail in front of a three-judge , he gave a statement. He admitted he’d killed Sydney but insisted it wasn’t premeditated. He had killed her because he was worried that Sydney would go to the policehe let her go. “I won’t say I’m sorry, as that would be an insult to you after what I put you through,” Trail said to Sydney’s family. “And I won’t ask for forgiveness as I don’t believe there is such a thing. I have done some terrible things in my le, but this is the only thing I have ever done that I feel real regret about.” The judges said Trail had displayed a “cold, calculated” level of planning, pointing out that he had even bragged about the killing afterwards and joked that he had drunk Sydney’s blood. They said that dismembering her body was needless and done to satisfy his “intellectual and sexual curiosity”. Trail was given the death penalty. At Boswell’s sentencing last month, she also faced the death penalty. She begged for her le to be spared for her “daughter’s sake”. The judges said Sydney had found herself in the killers’ flat, outnumbered and unable to defend herself. “Boswell’s actions and words demonstrate that she had no regard for the le of Sydney Loofe beyond her own pleasure,” one judge said. But one judge didn’t agree on the death penalty, so Boswell was sentenced to le in prison without parole. Her legal team said they would appeal. news weird-news experts-agree-bigfoot-could-real-"Werewolf or Bigfoot caught on CCTV according to believersByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Dec | commentsAn incredible video that appears to show Bigfoot has been shared online and now even experts admit the mythical beast could be real. In the clip, filmed in Georgia, US, a huge ape-like creature can be seen lurking behind some trees, while the witness films from some distance away.The beast then stands - revealing that it is impressively tall, although in the shaky footage it is hard to tell exactly how big the animal is, as the Daily Star reports.The footage has been widely shared on social media and people are convinced it is a genuine Bigfoot sighting, and even experts seem to agree.  What do you think, is Bigfoot real  Let us know in the comments... The video was shared on Instagram by the account @cryptiduniversity which regularly uploads clips of mysterious creatures.One viewer said: Best footage Iaposve seen in a while - that thing was huge. A more sceptical-sounding viewer said: They do all sorts of things for attention down in Georgia.Seth Breedslove, a documentary maker and the man behind Small Town Monsters film production company, said the video might be a hoax but there was room for doubt.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. He said: The subject seems to be very large but the movement possibly gives away the potential for some trickery. The subject seems to be looking down at the ground as it turns indicating it might be a person in a suit who is having some dficulty judging the forest floor beneath them. It makes me think this is more than likely a hoax.  The filmmaker, whose latest documentary On The Trail of Bigfoot is now available on Amazon, added: The thing does appear to be large though, so maybe it’s real  These videos always leave us with more questions than answers.Legends of Bigfoot in the US gained momentum in  when loggers found a giant footprint in Bluff Creek, Calornia, and it became a national news story. Conspiracy theorists think there might be other hidden creatures, known as cryptids, lurking in the wilds, and among these legends are dogman, mothman, the yeti, and even Nessie the Loch Ness Monster.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: i revenge sister after made
story: I got revenge on my sister after she made fun of the Netflix shows I watchA woman took to Reddit to ask users for advice after her sister made fun of her in front of her entire family for what she watches on Netflix - but the majority of people were on her side Image: Future Publishing via Getty ImagesByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Dec | comments A woman has revealed how she started a family row after she changed her Netflix password. Posting on Redditaposs Am I The A**hole subreddit, the woman explained that her sister asked for her Netflix account details a few months ago for her boyfriend, as she uses her friendaposs account.This wasnapost a problem, the poster said, as heaposd created his own profile so as not to interfere with what she was watching. However, a few days ago, the whole family were having dinner at her sisteraposs house when she started making fun of the stupid shows she watches after she admitted sheaposd taken a look at her account. She said: I asked her how she even knew what shows I watched and she admitted to using her boyfriendaposs account to snoop through my account. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. I told her this was not okay and I don’t want her going through my preferences and then going so far as making fun of me for it, and I changed the password to the account. She called me yesterday, yelling about how I had no right to do that and calling me a b****. Now admittedly I do feel a little bad because her boyfriend technically didn’t do anything wrong. She concluded her post by asking whether she was unreasonable for changing the password, but the majority of people were on her side. The top comment with over , upvotes states that although the boyfriend did nothing wrong, her sister abused her login information. They added: It’s a privilege, not a right, and you had EVERY right to change your info. Another wrote: Screw that. You want to call me out and embarrass me in front of the family  Then you can’t have my login information. Grow up. Also, I might feel a little personal about this, because I just cut my younger sister off my Hulu and Netflix for being an a**. You insult, you don’t get to have the privilege. A third commented: You were doing her a favour essentially by allowing her boyfriend to use your account. She has no right to demand what you do with your account. It’s yours, shepay to use it. She is so entitled and rude. Someone  wrote: I bet the bf understands completely. Sister can learn.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: ive bought loads christmas gifts
story: Ive bought loads of Christmas gts for my man but he refuses to give me anyA woman has expressed her frustration after revealing shed spent hundreds on Christmas gts for her boyfriend, only to discover he wasnt getting anything for herThe woman spent hundreds on gts for her boyfriend Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Dec | comments Itaposs officially that time of year, when the drinks are flowing, the pigs in blankets are endless and our bank accounts are looking a little bit worse for wear. But, most of us would all agree itaposs worth it when youaposre sitting around the tree swapping presents and sipping on Champagne with loved ones.In fact, many people would argue that thereaposs more pleasure in giving gts than receiving them, but thataposs not necessarily the caseyouaposre just giving and not receiving at all.Sadly, thataposs the exact situation one woman has found herself in, after shelling out hundreds of pounds on Christmas presents for her boyfriend, only to discover heaposs not getting her anything at all.The woman and her partner have been dating for almost a year, but this is the first Christmas theyaposll be spending as a couple, so of course, she wanted to go out and spoil him to show how much he means to her.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Today I brought up that I couldnapost wait for Christmas and I was wondering what my parents were going to get me, she explained on a Reddit thread, before adding that her boyfriend then launched into a rant about how he doesnapost agree with buying presents for others. Gobsmacked by what her boyfriend had just told her, she asked: So, youaposre not getting me anything  To which he responded: Nah. He went on to tell her that heaposs never bought gts for anything, so thereaposs no reason why she should be any dferent. We spoke for a long while about why and such, but itaposs not important as in the end he still isnapost going to give me anything. I feel asIaposm obviously not too important to himhe hasnapost gone out of his way to get me even a tiny gt,the woman added. I made it clear I do like giving and receiving presents, and I told him Iaposd already bought his, so he said heaposd take his then. I think itaposs a little selfish heaposs going to accept his present without giving me anything. The woman was then met with mixed responses from other Reddit users, with some suggesting she should change her mind about giving her boyfriend his gts. Iaposdhis gts and buy yourself something. If he isnapost buying you a gt, you should buy your own, one suggested. However, another disagreed: No. This is petty. You need to realise that Christmas is not about an equal exchange but giving.What do you think, should she still give her man the gts  Have your say in the comments section...Read MoreRead MoreMost ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON RedditChristmas gtsChristmasRelationships" data-immediate"data-immediate"Join the Secret Elves for celebration inspiration - and brilliant gt ideas and reviewsSpread the cheer!Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news labrador-squeals-excitement-owner-mentions-"Dog over excited about first run with owner in monthsByEdward KayNiche Video Journalist:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsWhen it comes to putting your all into cardio, this dog surely takes the crown. Scout, a Labrador cross Catahoula leopard dog, shows just how much energy she has in this incredible display of athleticism and enthusiasm. The excitable dog’s reaction when she first hears the word “run” from her owner was amusing enough as she repeatedly lets out an adorable high pitched squeal. But viewers are then shown how powerful the dog is as she begins to sprint, pulling her owner along with her. As the Lab cross is first shown on camera, her owner utters the magic word and she’s off, bounding around the garden in excitement. She changes into her harness and waits impatiently at the gate for her owner, barking as she jumps.  Once the two leave the garden, Scout has to hold back just a few more seconds before she gets the signal to set off properly. But once the dog gets the go ahead, she wastes no time, instantly beginning a full sprint, dragging her owner along on a skateboard behind as she goes. The rest of the clip shows just how fast and for how long Scout can carry her owner behind her, in an impressive feat of athleticism. Scout is even careful to look back and check on her owner at every turn, showing she is caring as well as full of energy.The video was uploaded by TikTok user @thisisscout, and the clip was a huge hit on the video sharing , with over , views and over , likes.Viewers were impressed with Scout’s energy, with one user commenting: “I think she was a sled dog in a former le. She loves it!” Another commenter wrote: “I just love hearing her squeaky bark of excitement and pure joy when she first starts to pull.” A third added: “I love how your dog keeps looking back to seeyou’re still good.”Scout isn’t the only energetic Lab to have garnered attention on social media recently, after Duke’s reaction to going to potty in the garden tickled Facebook users.The Labrador was incredibly excited after using the backyard to go to the toilet, sprinting all round the grass and the decking. Duke’s owner was very amused by her dog in the clip, praising him as he bounded round the garden. The TeamDogs Christmas Gt Guide, sponsored by Keep Wales Tidy, is packed with more than  treats, toys, gadgets and garments to make every dog’s tail wag with holly jolly joy on December . Weaposve tried and tested many of the gts on our own TeamDogs friends so you can ensure they’re worth placing under the tree for your most special member of the family. To download our Christmas Gt Guide for free simply subscribe to the TeamDogs newsletter.Another Labrador cross to have enjoyed TikTok success of late was Jake, whose habit of taking a torch with him to use the toilet in the dark amused viewers.Jake takes the torch from his owner before being let out into the garden to use the toilet. The clever dog uses the trick to combat his fear of the dark, obediently bringing the torch back to his owner when he is finished. title: make up fan tests 100
story: Make-up fan tests  mascaras to see which ones to avoid and her absolute favouriteA beauty fan who has almost , followers on TikTok has tested  mascaras to see which are her favourite, and which ones didnt live up to her expectationsKelly tested  mascaras to see which was the best and worst Image: Kelly Rose Sarno TikTokByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsWith so many mascaras on the market, it can be tough to know which one is for you. There are mascaras that promise thick, voluminous lashes, and others that give you extreme . But not all of them do what they say on the tin. Thankfully, we donapost need to spend a fortune deciphering the good from the bad as make-up fan Kelly Rose Sarno has done the hard work for us.Kelly has built a following of almost , on her TikTok account @kellyrosesarno, with her beauty tutorials. In a recent video, Kelly ranked the top  best and worst mascaras, with the caption: Is @benefitcosmetics Bad Gal Bang still my # favourite  Here is my updated top  best and worst! For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. She explained: I have tested over  mascaras. I’m the girl that tests out mascaras so that you don’t have to and here is my updated top ten and top worst. Kelly kicks off the video with the top ten mascaras to avoid. She said: “Kicking off the top  do not is the Bite upswing mascara, Mayblelline snapscara, Kat Von Dee go big or go home, Ulta twisted volume, YSL volume effect, Blinc original tubing mascara, Smashbox super fan mascara, besty long curl mascara, baddie lashes mascara. “Number two on my do not buy list is the mascara from Physicians formula with the fibre extensions and my number one do not buy mascara is the Florence by Mills which makes me so sad because I love her, but you can literally see how bad this mascara is, right through the tube.” Then, she moves on to her favourite mascaras. She said: I will have you know, I do not take this lightly. I am looking for a formula that lasts, that gives me , separation and volume. Kicking off top ten with Ilia limitless lash mascara, Maybelline the falsies push-up drama, Essence lash princess Aurora volume mascara from the Disney princess line, L’Oreal Paris unlimited mascara , Vivienne Sabo Paris Cabaret première, Patrick Ta major volume mascara, Elf lash it loud, Butter London stroke of wow volumising mascara. Coming in at number  but it’s really . is Rare Beauty - I absolutely love this mascara, it works on all levels. But after  mascaras, Bad Gal Bang from Benefit still reigns supreme. This mascara gives me , separation, volume and the tube lasts literally forever. After over  mascaras, she is still reigning supreme. Since being posted, the video has racked up almost , likes and , comments from thankful viewers, with many agreeing that Benefitaposs Bag Gal Bang mascara is their favourite too. One person said: I totally agree... Bad Gal Bang #. Another wrote: I bought the Bag Girl Bang after watching this vid and IT IS WONDERFUL. Thank you for the recommendation!! A third said: You should make your own brand. While someone  said: I have literally used LaposOreal Voluminous mascara since I was in high school and Iaposm in my s. I have tried many but always go back.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: my sister law refuses come
story: My sister-in-law refuses to come over for Christmas as she’s trying for babyA mum has been left feeling hurt after her sister-in-law refused to come round for Christmas because she cant deal with her "good fortune being rubbed in her face"The sister-in-law recently text to say they wouldnt be able to come over for Christmas Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Dec | comments A mum has sparked an interesting debate on an incredibly sensitive subject, after learning that her sister-in-law would not be coming to spend Christmas with her family this year.Her husbandaposs sister and her husband were supposed to be coming over this Christmas to celebrate with the extended family something has been planned since around August this year. However, the sister-in-law very recently got in touch to say they wouldnapost be coming as planned, as theyaposre currently trying to conceive, and didnapost want their good fortune rubbed in her face.My husband and his sister have a strained relationship and have since childhood. I have always got on very well with her but she has a competitive edge which is draining after a while, the mum, who has two children, aged one and four, wrote on Mumsnet. She always said we would have weddings children around the same time but it just didnapost work out that way. They have been trying for their first since June after their wedding in May. She continued: It was agreed ages ago that we would host my sister-in-law and her husband, my mother and father-in-law and my parents and siblings for Christmas, as the in-lawsapos house is only a mile from us and my family will stay over. My sister-in-law has messaged tonight and said she canapost see us over Christmas, as itaposs too hard whilst theyaposre trying to conceive and she canapost have our aposgood fortune rubbed in her face.apos Sheaposs also said she would prefer her parents also decline so they can spend it together. The mum went on to say that sheaposs completely sympathetic as to how hard it is to spend time with babies when youaposre so desperate to have some of your own, but explained that her having good fortune is not entirely the case. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. In between my two children, I suffered an ectopic where I lost a tube, as well as two early losses and a -week loss. She knows this, she watched me go through the entire f***ing thing, she wrote. The comment on good fortune has gone around and around my tiny head all evening and Iaposm p***ed off about it, I feel as though sheaposs worded it like that deliberately to hit a chord. I know I do have very good fortune to have two healthy children and Iaposm so grateful but f***, the youngest was hard won and I feel as though sheaposs poked the best a bit. One Mumsnet user responded: As someone who struggled please donapost take it personally. She is probably so far inside her own head over being upset and stressed that your struggle probably hasnapost even registered. I suspect from her point of view, she’d take your pain infor two healthy kids. Infertility is tough, please try to be gentle, another added. A third wrote: It’s not fucking infertility when she’s been trying a few months. I speak as someone who obsessively avoided babies and Christmas after trying for FIVE years. Sorry, but she’s being an absolute dick. I hope your in laws still come as I think it would be totally unfairthey didn’t.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: pregnant woman given dirty looks
story: Pregnant woman given dirty looks and called lazy for refusing to give up seat on busA pregnant woman has been left wonderingshe did the right thing after refusing to give up her seat on the bus for an older woman who branded her lazy as a resultShes not sureshe did the right thingImage: Getty ImagesByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Dec | commentsUsing public transport these days can make some of us feel rather uncomfortable, following on from the pandemic, as you end up in pretty close quarters with other people. One woman claims she was recently taking the bus home when she found herself in an awkward situation with an older woman who wanted to sit by herself as she didnapost feel safe. In a post on Reddit, the younger woman, who had just finished an eight hour day at work is currently  weeks pregnant, says she sat downstairs on the bus, as she had lots of heavy shopping bags and was nervous about falling on the stairs. She purposefully says she avoided sitting in the priority seats but instead was sat behind them when she was asked to move by a more senior lady with a walking stick. And the situation resulted in some drama on the bus. Her post on the Am I The A**hole forum read: AITA for not giving up my seat on the bus   Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. So Igot on the bus after an eight hour day in work. Now I get on at very first stop on the bus route and get off at the very last stop the whole journey takes about two hours.When I got on the bus it was quite busy on the bottom deck, with only one double seat left available. Usually, I would go upstairs when itaposs this busy but this time I had about - slightly heavy bags with me and didnapost feel safe trying to get up the stairs with them especially since Iaposm  weeks pregnant, so I sat on the seat downstairs. About halfway through the journey, an older lady with a stick got on the bus and she asked me to move. She wasnapost even polite when she asked and honestly I thought she meant move over so she could sit next to me. So I moved my bags and started to scoot over, when she aposNo, No I meant can you find another seat, this seat is reserved for disabled people. You are clearly not disabled. There are plenty of seats upstairsapos. These seats were not priority seats for disabled people the ones in front of me werebut these ones were not. so I replied, aposSorry, I really donapost feel safe going up the stairs with all these bags, I donapost mind you sitting next to me though, we both have our masks onapos.  She claims the other woman told her she didnapost want to sit next to anyone  as she didnapost feel safe. She then instructed the younger woman to move your lazy fat behind and give the seat to someone who needs it. The -year-old added: I hate confrontation and I absolutely hate people who use their pregnancy as an excuse, which means I hate what I said next. Lady I am pregnant, I am not going up those stairs with these bags and risking a fall. If you really want a seat to yourself ask someone  to move. A man sitting across from them then offered up his seat and went upstairs, but not before giving the pregnant woman a dirty look. She added: The lady spent the next - minutes talking with the other oldies on the bus about how the kids these days have no respect for their elders or people with disabilities, or how they would have never have spoken to someone like in their day. This happened a couple of days ago, while my boyfriend and my dad said I was in the right, but I canapost help but feel like I acted like an entitled brat. More than  people have since responded to the womanaposs post, with many agreeing that she was not in the wrong for standing her ground. One person said: NTA. You shouldaposve pointed out where the disabled seats were. Also, f**k older people who think their age entitles them to respect...theyaposre usually the ones lacking manners. Another wrote: All seats on the bus were double seats so she would have had to have sit next to someone, which she said she didnapost want to do. So basically she wanted a double seat to herself. A third commented: You are  weeks pregnant and you were making the right decision to keep you and baby safe. What do you think  Let us know in the comments below. title: woman hysterics realises adopted dog
story: Woman in hysterics as she realises her adopted dog only understands SpanishA woman took to TikTok to share hilarious footage of her four-year-old Chihuahua Max responding to her commands in Spanish and ignoring her when she talks to him in EnglishKalee adopted a dog from a shelter Image: kaleemcgee TikTokByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsA dog owner was left in hysterics when she realised the reason her new pup had been ignoring her was that he could only understand Spanish. Kalee McGee explained that when she adopted four-year-old Chihuahua Max from the shelter, he had no paperwork about his background. But because he was well behaved when she took him for walks, and he sits down when she gives him a treat, she assumed heaposd had some training. However, Kalee couldn’t work out why Max wasnapost listening to her. Until one day when she finally figured it out - he only understood Spanish.She shared the hilarious discovery on her TikTok account@kaleemcgee , where she said: “I’m gonna talk fast because your time is precious but this is hilarious and I have no one  to tell so please listen. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here.“We adopted a dog two, three weeks ago, a great little chihuahua four years old from the shelter, no information on him, absolutely adorable, super great. “He sits when you have a treat in your hand not when you say sit, he knows what a crate is and he walks really well on a leash so it seems he has some training, but he won’t listen to us so. “We’re trying to get him to sit, trying to get him to do this stuff for weeks and we can’t figure out why he won’t listen to us…” Then they worked it out. He only speaks Spanish, she said. Our little chihuahua doesn’t know English and has been looking at us like what are you talking about. I died when I found out so I’ve got to show you. In the next clip, when she says Max come, he just stands there. But when she repeats the phrase in Spanish, he walks straight over to her wagging his tail. The same thing happens when she tells Max to sit. In English he ignores her, and in Spanish, he does exactly what she says.“I don’t speak Spanish so I know that wasn’t the best, we’ve been relying on Google Translate, but pleaseyou have anything  let me know cause I would love to see how smart this cute little man is. I just don’t speak his language.”Since being posted, the video has racked up more than . million likes and , comments from people who were impressed by Kalee’s dedication. One person said: “How did you find out he speaks Spanish LOL.” Another wrote: The fact that you learned good boy in Spanish,” with a sad emoji. A third said: The thought of a person learning a new language for their new pup has me tearing up rn.” Someone  shared a list of Spanish phrases she could try with Max. They said: “Quieto  stay, vamos  let’s go, comida  food, galleta  treat. These are not universal, but work for my chi.”Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: inside 160 year old abandoned
story: Inside -year-old abandoned mansion left after owner tragically died in explosionFormer owner, Lady Cochrane Sursock, died in hospital but the luxury residence is still a part of its namesake’s family who are committed to restoring itThe interior of the mansion showing signs of damage from the explosion Image: Jam Press Roman RobroekBySarah BakerGraeme Murray:,  Dec | commentsA glimpse has been given behind the doors of a -year-old abandoned mansion after its owner died in an explosion. A photographer explored Sursock Palace, one of the last remaining residences of the Lebanese Ottoman-era which is directly in line with the disaster site. Former owner, Lady Cochrane Sursock, was inside the luxury residence during the Port of Beruit explosion but died in hospital sometime later. Despite being built in the s, the luxury residence is still a part of its namesake’s family who are committed to restoring it. A reconstruction plan for the property is expected to take six years and cost an estimated €million Roman Robroek, , a full-time photographer from the Netherlands, was able to get inside the palace to capture not only the damage, but some of the impressive surviving features as well. He said: “Photographing Sursock Palace was part of a project I was shooting for The Heritage Management Organization last summer, where I was covering the impact of the blast that happened in the Port of Beirut in August  on the architecture and cultural heritage in the city. “For this project, we partnered with a local NGO called Silat for culture.  The lovely people of Silat for culture took care of my daily schedule, driving and arranging all the required permissions to enter the locations in the city. A lot of work was involved. “The owner of the palace, Roderick Cochrane, was kind enough to open the doors of his palace for me to photograph the damage caused by the blast.” In addition to art pieces, paintings, books and china, rooms directly facing the harbour where the explosion happened were most damaged. Roman said: “Trust me, the harbour is really close to the palace. All of the glass was shattered and much of the indoor stucco was damaged “The amount of damage I encountered was a big surprise to me. It was tough to see the impact of the blast on the architecture and state of the building. There was so much debris and valuable items were damaged.”  The extent of the destruction can be seen in the once intricately decorated ceiling, which has now been replaced with a temporary metal roof to weatherproof the site and prevent further damage. In hopes of structurally preserving the building, the exterior is clad in scaffolding and netting. Inside, ornate walls and exposed beams are being supported with multiple metal structures. The former grandeur of the palace is still detectable in certain rooms. The elaborate golden front door, stone pillars and arched windows are just a few of the impressive features.  Roman added: “The main and double staircase of the building is one of the features that stood out to me. The craftsmanship in the ironwork and the chandelier are stunning.” The building and its contents were never insured resulting in ious international organisations, university students and other parties stepping in to offer extra support to save its historic grandeur.  The palaceaposs origin goes back to Constantinople and the Sursocks have been recorded as living in Beirut since . The owneraposs wealth is said to have came from in the early th century primarly in agriculture and later in manufacturingAccording to its website, the Sursock empire extended from Mersine, Turkey to Alexandria, Egypt passing by Lebanon, Cyprus and Palestine.
